dialogues.text: Thinking I should just give the first half back now...'cuz I know right now I'll never hurt her. Toss the envelope into the glove-box, slam it shut. Scan. heads in one of the unmarked patrol cars I ordered. Curso nods as they pass. Tail-lights fade. Dead quiet save my l Jazz. Fighting my drift. Check my Hamilton. 10:00. Grimac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sense of time. Exhaustion steals it. A full hour earlier than I told                     * Junior to meet me. I need sleep.                        * Yawn. Look up...Lucille Magdalena at her window. Sudden. Startling: no blouse, pig-tails, big silver-dollar nipple touch/steam glass. Pushes the curtains back even further. Adrenaline cuts through the lactic acid: wide awake now. I see her eyes aren't sex-placid or rolled back -- they'r scanning -- hopeful to glimpse someone outside looking ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This routine had been done before. That old broad babbling about a Peeper. The only other link to Hector Magdalena's disappearance.                       * She holds her scan for a blink, a different smile, eyes s placid now, rolled-back now -- she just saw what she was looking for: hidden eyes staring back at her. I look to w I saw her gaze kink...unholster my .45. Get out quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold for LA. Walking/scanning, .45 flush against my leg. Sticking to shadows. Cross the street: two homes down. Qu steps. Closer: a snubbed cigarette smoulders in the gutte Glance back up at the window, Lucille gone -- a forearm shiver flashes from nowhere blunts/blasts the back of my head. Nose-first into asphalt. Too angry to black out. Sp blood and scream at the same time so it sounds like drown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still unsure what hit me. Pick-up my gun, clear my nose o gouting blood, stand, weave: a figure in black, sprinting away: PEEPER. Wipe away impact-tears, aim, realize my tri finger is dislocated -- bent back ugly. Tuck the gun use left hand to pop it back in -- deep growl -- re-aim: POP-POP-POP. The Peeper pitches. Visible in the streetlig a red puff off his right shoulder. Headlights at end of t block, behind me, come to life now- Baritone of a big V-8 Peeper fighting for balance, keeps running. I sprint heedless, round the corner: follow a blood-trail panting, bleeding my own trail. Lift my eyes to see the Peeper shoulder through a fence, vanish into a backyard. Neighborhood mutts yelp a chorus. I cross the street- -those headlights swerve hard in front of me: Black Buick look down in time to watch my knee detonate a quarter-pan I bounce off like someone yanked a leash. Crumble-yell. H pick me up. I fight back before I even see at whom I'm swinging: square-jawed types, eyes hidden by Bureau derbi Welles Noonan gets out of the passenger-side of the Buick Punches me as hard as he can without provocation: nothing write home about. My gun clatters to the ground. WELLES NOONAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for Sanderline Johnson. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nod at the Peeper trail)

dialogues.speaker: ARE YOU BLIND-
dialogues.text: WELLES NOONAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -what were you firing at? ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only lead on Magdalena -- we're after the same guy you idiot! WELLES NOONAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to one of the goons) -write that name down: `Magda-LEE- na' or `Magda-LAY-na.' (back to me) No, we were after you. But thanks for the name. Sag under the weight of my own insomnia-fed stupidity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assumed the Feds were smart. Assumed they were ready to stick a new probe into the LAPD's deal with Hector, like Bradley warned, like everyone feared. But they had no                        * clue and I just handed them the whole God damn thing. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said: I need sleep... Raise my face now, eyes intent, chin out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First punch you ever thrown Noonan? Your Mom have to teach you how because Dad was the same no-chin, Connecticut Faggot you are? Noonan stops, turns back to me: blazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I hit the Noonan family dynamic, dead-on. He winds up an overhand right: a big-bright flash, then darkness that feels like lying down on a sunlit lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to take him in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only want to bring him in when I know he'll never leave. BLACK dissolves to something LIGHTER, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horizontal. Someone pushed a table and two chairs to one side: space for the cot I'm on. Look up. Junior looking down: `Concerned' isn't strong enough. In his undershirt. slips the red steno pad into his back pocket. Sit up. A balled dress shirt in my hand, blood sopped. Gaze at my Hamilton, face cracked, `5:16am'-- Fritz Koeni walks in, silver pitcher in hand. I gape up, still punchy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee? KOENIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice. Bradley's on his way down. Toss the dress shirt to the floor. JUNIOR STEMMONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's mine...you needed some                        * mopping up. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who found me? JUNIOR STEMMONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. I got there at eleven like you said, right as two black & white's pulled up: you were out                      * cold in a gutter `round the block.                   * (this blithe little grin) Did Noonan knock you out? ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hit me with his car first. JUNIOR STEMMONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a nod to Koenig) The Captain was the only one here at this hour...                                      * Look from Junior and Koenig to the window behind him -- Bradley steam-rolling our way. To Koenig, conspiratorial: KLEIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I need your help later on, can I count on it? KOENIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you can. Take the pitcher from him, drop my head, douse myself, th cold cuts cobwebs. Bradley walks in, imperious. Koenig mo past -- ice forms between the two. KOENIG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief. BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? KOENIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lieutenant was thirsty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Koenig closes the door. I refuse to look up at Bradley. BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Progress on Magdalena. I point to Junior -- happy to play teacher's pet: JUNIOR STEMMONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fingerprints. Clean crime scene. Canvassed the neighborhood. A senile neighbor did report a possible Peeper- -rubbing the back of my head where the Peeper bashed me- ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -confirmed Peeper. Bradley turns to me: BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that who knocked you out? ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noonan knocked me out. BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) He's having you tailed then... ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he knows the Magdalena name and that I was chasing a suspect -- the                    * Peeper Lucille strips for.                             * JUNIOR STEMMONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows someone watches? ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who he is. She has to. (back to Bradley) I want access to her juvie sheet or                    * whatever arrest records exist.                         * Rumor was Hector whored her out to                     * dealers he did business with.                          * BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's immaterial.                                     * ME                                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as my teeth grit)                                 * It is if you're eliminating her as                     * a suspect-                                             *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRADLEY                                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -did you confirm their alibi?                        * Point to the ever-studious Junior. JUNIOR STEMMONS                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spoke with a Mr. and Mrs. Preston                  * Mott of Santa Barbara, the parents                   * of Madge Magdalena nee Mott and                      * they've confirmed their visit and                    * also corroborated the argument that                  * resulted in them leaving early.                      * BRADLEY                                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to me now)                                 * One alteration to my previous orders- ME                                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -previous orders being what? Assign the Cop Noonan blames for his dead boxing probe to the case that's becoming his new crusade?                            * Bradley conjures the Roman visage...then slowly opens the door, staring holes in me. BRADLEY                                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step out Stemmons.                                   * Junior balks, looks my way: tries to mimic my sneer. I st and shove him toward the door. His look back at me: Judas Bradley closes the door behind him. BRADLEY (CONT'D)                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No direct approach on the mother or                  * the daughter.                                        * ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Madge was a battered wife and                    * Lucille was a suborned whore. If                     * that's not motive, what is? You                      * want answers then we brace those                     * two hard. BRADLEY                                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you do so directly, if they're                    * formally questioned then Noonan may                  * find out and go after them with Federal warrants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noonan will figure out who and what Hector was sooner or later.                     * BRADLEY                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes he will, so we buy time, keep him busy- ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -until when? BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until Tom Bethune votes on the floor of the city council in two days, ratifying the official start of construction on Dodger stadium- ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -this is bigger than a fucking ballpark! Hector Magdalena and Narco is the powder-keg, blows the              * whole Department to hell.                       * BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be dramatic, it looks weak. Right now, Noonan needs a pursuit, so I supply him with one-                       * ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -me. You want me to draw him off-               * BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -you've been drawing him off. And the more he sees you the less he'll think of anything other than getting you. Now find Tommy and                 * take him alive. Do not let Noonan               * get to him. As a potential major                * case witness against the LAPD,                  * Tommy Magdalena isn't just a powder-            * keg, he's an atom bomb.                         * Bradley walks. Watch him disappear down the hall. ME (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bradley has a bigger angle and I'm getting close to it...I just haven't hit home. Yet.                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a clean T-shirt from my locker. Heading toward Junior' desk. All eyes on my wounds. I toss Stemmons his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seltzer will take the blood out. Junior bitchy, like some broad you stood up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give you the shirt off my back                        * and you bash me!                                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When a Superior Officer tells you to leave the room, you leave the                        * fucking room.                                           * Junior balls the shirt, stuffs it in his desk drawer. Tak deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made a file on the Bledsoe broad. The one you asked about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. But forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spent a whole day putting it together and this skirt's got skeletons. Reminded, glance at my hand: "A I N G E" in smeared ink. Junior rips open a file, blathers Bledsoe preliminaries:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoplifting in Bakersfield at 17. Prostitution arrest at 21. Known associate of a Kern County homicide victim, this convicted pimp named Dwight Gillette, probably her pimp. Stabbed to death in his home, weapon never recovered-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. Burn it, s'not important now. Take the file from him, flip through; thorough, detailed. Glenda priors scream back instant conviction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is it not important? Plant the file in his chest as my answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need an address on a guy named Ainge, George Ainge-                                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -what about Magdalena? My temper turning threadbare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -after you get the Ainge address,                       * get back to the Magda-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picks up Glenda's file)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -is Ainge related to this Cunt? Snap-grit-grab him: buttons from his shirt pop, bounce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're partners in name only. You want to stay in the room next time, Junior? Do something to impress me: like finding that address. Dig Junior trying to hide tears now behind that mad-dog glare: makes me want to break the bones in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving, running parallels to avoid Fed tails. No Black Buicks...But a Gray Packard shifts behind me on a cadence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noonan replaced the Buick with a                        * Packard and a better Shadow-Man.                        * But I could still spot the tail.                        * Run a red light at Rossmore, leave the Packard behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This jet-engine urge to see her. Needing it like a junkie does. No logic. Just the push.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving past Glenda's house now. No Corvette. Driving pas the Griffith Park `Vampires' set: addicts/crew rolling up sleeping bags. No Corvette. Pull the address list Dandy handed me: Talent Domiciles. Pasadena. Howard's Fuck-Pad supreme: A tudor mansion with airplane-shaped hedges. A Corvette in the drive. Stop at curb. Open shades. Flashes of her. Gathering something. C my Hamilton, look up as: KNOCK-KNOCK on my window. Her fa inches-close. Bags of groceries in her hands and this wry little smile: watch me kill Hughes's new Dick with kindne Roll the window down, stay blank-slate. She features my cuts/bruises. Her quiet, deep voice is like medicine: GLENDA BLEDSOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better looking than the last guy Howard hired. Once you heal. (she recognizes me) Wait a minute. You were there, the other night, the Bethune Party...                     * My heart jammed up into my throat. Push past it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.                                                 * GLENDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey told me this `Bent Cop' everybody used to call- (mocking, I love it:) -`The Enforcer' was asking about me. Told me to be careful. So you're LAPD after all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In theory. GLENDA BLEDSOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to arrest me for breaking and entering? ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends. (nod to groceries) Those Howard's? GLENDA BLEDSOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's Howard's. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLENDA BLEDSOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I left. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just shop here now? GLENDA BLEDSOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of our extras haven't had a vegetable since Truman. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attack of the Atomic Vampires... GLENDA BLEDSOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles, no flinch) We can't all be Audrey Hepburn. Plus it pays bills. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than a billionaire does? Go make amends and finish out your service contract Ms. Bledsoe. GLENDA BLEDSOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if there was just one day left on it. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? GLENDA BLEDSOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm better than that. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're also better than a starring role in schlock horror flick that'll never see a screen, regardless if it's leading lady gets `kidnapped' or not.                              * Drop that coffee cup from the other night into her bag. S beat, but bluffs by. GLENDA BLEDSOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't the first time you've spied on me. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nor the second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you've got me all giftwrapped, Enforcer-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Dave. You're on Hughes' bad side Ms. Bledsoe. It's not a bright place to be. So please go-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Glenda. (this smile just for me)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And tell Howard I'll take my chances with the fake vampires. And she twirls off, gone...watch her go...my radio buzzes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klein. Go ahead...                                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Message from a Lester Lake: asked that you contact him immediately. Ignition. Gas. Tires catch smoke as I peel away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of dimes, drop slugs instead. Three rings, somebody s it before the fourth. Background reverb blares, bar racke Hear a muted male growl `Club Alabam...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me Lester. This is Lieutenant Klein, LAPD- -click. Fuck. Fish for another slug. Redial. One ring. Pi up, same background din-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (push this out pronto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -this is LAPD-put Lester on the phone or I'll have your liquor license and after-hours permits yanked inside the hour... A muffled back and forth before Lester comes on the line:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got your message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LESTER LAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl that works here, gigs the late sets, the torch stuff Fridays and                 * Saturdays, name of Tilly Hopwell.                 * ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw her singing the other night. LESTER LAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she's been truckin' with Tommy Mag. Got pipes like Ella but she's a junk fiend: caught her                    * mainlining in the ladies room a month back.                                       * ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroin? Tommy get her hooked? LESTER LAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunno, but when he'd get drunk,                   * he'd trade Horse for blowjobs out                 * back a' the club.                                 * ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's this girl now?                            * LESTER LAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't show up for work last night.               * Called a friend of hers, a waitress that works here too, said she was                 * at Bido Lito's in Hollywood. Said                 * she was `hiding out.' ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She actually said `hiding out?'                   * LESTER LAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she got off the phone. Fast. If Tilly's running with that demon,               * you gotta get her out of there. She               * got a lot more good in her than not-              * -Hang up. Paw the phone book. Tear out the address for Bi Lito's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smart Tommy. Dodging Darktown altogether. Holed up in Hollywood. Hiding in plain sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back booth with a view of the street. Bido Lito's across way. Eyeball the entrance and adjoining alley. On the tab in front of me, mugshots: known Tommy Magdalena associate Mostly greaser kids with low-rent juvie sheets. Stare at that photo of Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stakeout work. Browse mugs. Match a face out front if I get lucky. Wait till Bido Lito's gets busy before I make my move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snub my last Chesterfield, stifle a yawn, check my Hamilt 9:20 PM. Bito Crowd bops out front. Valet ballet. Scanning...spot a face...pull my mugshots...Steve Wenzel, Okie white-trash from El Monte, shoving his way through t crush out in front of the club, hits the side alley. I'm up. Dump a pocketful of coins on the table. Hit the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cross fast, play the wall and the shadows close. Watch as Wenzel climbs steps to a flop overtop of the club. Get de into the alley: a padlocked two-car overhang at the rear. Grip my .45, stock down, swing, split the lock. Chain spo at my feet, slide inside the overhang...a car concealed u a tarpaulin, peel it off slow...revealing a red `32 Ford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy's Deuce.                                       * Pull the pig-sticker off my ankle, stab the Driver-side t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now he's on foot.                                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy the door,   slide inside silent. Muffled sounds thr the floor, some   jazz combo wailing away at Bido Lito's Voices down the   hall, male, laughter, goofball guffaws. George Gobel on   the tube: `Well, I'll be a dirty bird! Creep in a crouch, my .45 at the hip, safety off. Move to the flicker at the far end of the hall. Sounds of pissing nearby, ease around a doorjamb .45 first: bedroom barren, dust-caked mattress, a half dozen bottles of Old Crow lie scattered among sash cords & used heroin spikes. Light from the bathroom...a pair of legs visible, female. Dark but pale, splayed from inside the bathroom...the rig foot slowly moves back and forth like the heel is trying gain some purchase on fast-draining life. Somebody flushe zips up, steps over the two legs. Duck back into the hall as this Greaser stinking of pomad wafts past, weaving back toward the TV room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside. Move fast now. A fist-sized lump swells mid-chest blossoms into my throat. I don't want to see what I know there. Turn the corner: Club Alabam songbird Tilly Hopwell. Three breaths from de A spike snapped off in her greyish, motionless left arm. right hand claws at tile. These beautiful dark eyes stare at me like she was hoping for someone sooner. Throttle ma on her neck, one breast exposed, bra pulled down for a gr I don't want to touch her face but I do...she closes her the moment my fingertips hit. That gases my hate. Choke b sudden tears.

dialogues.speaker: FUCK YOU DOIN'
dialogues.text: Turn back. GREASER in the doorway, brown-bagged T-Bird hi the floor as he reaches for his waist -- stand and shoot in the throat. Drive the .45 into his sternum like a blad before I fire the second-third-fourth shots. He falls/fla Jump-shock from the other room.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE
dialogues.text: Bodies scramble. No words. Just Pistol fire through the h rotted walls -- punks taking potshots. No compliance mean hit the hallway shooting back. Firing dead-bang at a coup fleeing silhouettes -- see them pop-stumble-fall- -the archway above my head shreds, collapses. Somebody fi a sub-machine gun. Flat on my ass, my back finds the wall cough up plaster, sleeve my eyes to see. Then quiet, save rattle-clap of changing clips.

dialogues.speaker: -YOU SET ME UP YOU COCKSUCKER
dialogues.text: Machine-gun fire lights up my left side. Roll. Taste floo grime as subsonic zips snap close...bullets miss by inche

dialogues.speaker: WILHITE
dialogues.text: Every part of me pauses...`Wilhite'...back door gets blun open, frantic footfalls recede. That big bent V-8 on Tomm `32 Deuce roars to life. Up now, plow through the cloud o cordite. See one of Tommy's Pachucos propped up against t wall, unhit, unhurt. Point my .45 and pull the trigger a pass. Hit an empty chamber...this punk's lucky day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out the door reloading as the `32 Deuce barrels away. Tom fires shots into the air to clear traffic. Wenzel in the passenger seat, screams to do the same. The Driver's side sparks fireworks. Pandemonium out in front of Bido Lito's as the crowd stampedes ass-over-elbows. Sprint to my car, inside, key dispatch fast as I wheel rough off the curb:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shots fired, 1600 block of Ivar.                        * Suspect fleeing scene in red `32                        * Ford Deuce travelling westbound on                      * Wilcox, vehicle impaired, intercept                     * at Hollywood Blvd-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -horns blare as I slalom club-goers scrambling across Iva Punch it over-top Sunset, parallel to the Deuce. Rip a le on Selma. Stay on my radio:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -and I need an ambulance to respond to 1607 North Ivar, second floor, female negro, possible overdose. Up ahead I catch a fireworks show: the Deuce gouges pavem across the 4-way. Clip 90 MPH catching up. Squeal onto Wi as Tommy hooks a right onto Hollywood. Two prowlers pass the next second, sirens lit, full screa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haul ass up to Hollywood, round it: See Tommy and Wenzel sitting upright, the Deuce spun sidelong, firing M3 `Grea Guns' into the approaching prowlers. Both cars go helter- skelter under fire. Six-packs spill to the street, belly crawl, brandish .38 service snubs and pop flimsy return f Tommy jumps down, runs, rifling his jacket for clips. Wen stays atop the car -- gun my engine, split the abandoned prowlers. Wenzel looks up mid-reload as I T-bone the `Deu at speed. The impact rockets him rag-doll end over end be he bombs back down to the street, wet sack, multiple bruises/fractures/breaks...blood pooling in pints. Tommy wide-eyes the heap that was Wenzel. Kick my driver' side door open firing. Tommy cuts loose with that Grease- sprays wild. Crouch-move as bullets thump wreckage and wh by overhead. More sirens approach. Tuck behind the front of the mangled `Deuce.' Another salvo from the Grease-Gun skips up off the paveme in front of me. The six-packs have regrouped, start layin down fire on Tommy. Tommy running now -- I'm up on one kn aiming, tucking into the .45: take his legs but don't kil -that Gray Packard materializes across the intersection i front of Tommy: shotgun blasts from the driver's side backseat obliterates Tommy's mid-section. My mouth gapes at what just happened...then I remember to fire at the Packard as it continues down the street, runn lights extinguished, no plates visible. Get to Tommy. Crying. Fading. Roll him on his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your father!? Did Wilhite                     * kill him!?- TELL ME! -bubbling blood in place of words. Mouth moves like a grouper's...get close...his last gasp...pray it's profoun He breathes out...nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving. Pissed. Radiator steam from under my crunched ho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Gray Packard: not the Feds.                      * Make them Magdalena rivals. I left                    * Bido Lito's too fast to catch a                       * tail. So where did they come from?                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magdalena home. Pull up onto the front lawn. Grab my bras knucks from the glove box. Out of my car. Growling. A pai Narco brims, Wilhite's boys, break wide on my approach. Junior stumbles from the stakeout car, rushing up the str toward me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave? (when I don't respond)                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave!                                                 *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside. Madge, this vacant glaze, tear-smudged, mock mour with more booze and pills...word of Tommy's demise has reached her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Dan Wilhite? Nothing from her. Music upstairs. Climb the steps two at time. Beeline Lucille's room. Shoulder the door off the j

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilhite and Lucille in the middle of some close conversat Giant startle from both:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILHITE                                     *

dialogues.speaker: KLEIN GET OUT OF HERE
dialogues.text: Grab Wilhite. He reeks of bad scotch. Present him like Exhibit A to Lucille: ME                                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he kill your piece-a'-shit pimp                   * Dad? Wilhite rips free. Beet-red. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or was it that Peeper across the                      * street that jacks off to your sad                     * little shows-                                         * WILHITE

dialogues.speaker: -GOD DAMN YOU
dialogues.text: Junior behind me. Urgent: JUNIOR STEMMONS                             *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, please! CHIEF BRADLEY!                          * At Wilhite: ME                                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Magdalena's body!?                            * LUCILLE                                     *

dialogues.speaker: FUCK YOU COP
dialogues.text: ME                                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (step to Lucille)

dialogues.speaker: FOR FREE NOW
dialogues.text: Sucks her steam: she knows I know. Her eyes shoot to Wilh Grab Lucille's bruised arms. Wilhite grabs me in return. footfalls coming hard up the steps, Wilhite reinforcement WILHITE                                     *

dialogues.speaker: YOU FUCKING THUG
dialogues.text: ME                                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You murdered him! That's why the                      * dogs didn't bark: they knew you-                      * -hands on me, ripping/hauling. Bull-rushed back into the by Wilhite's boys. I spin free. Wilhite flinches-trips. Junior too-close, plant my shoulder into him -- push off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUNIOR STEMMONS                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reeling back)                                  *

dialogues.speaker: NO DIRECT APPROACH ON MAGD-
dialogues.text: -grab Wilhite hard, haul him into a hallway bathroom, sla the door, lock it. WILHITE                                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you-                              * -shove him, show him the brass knucks- ME                                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -you're gonna shell it out for me                   * or I'm gonna kick your teeth in...                  * Junior beating on the door. ME (CONT'D)                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the door)                                   *

dialogues.speaker: FUCK OFF.
dialogues.text: Wilhite tries to push past. Gut-punch him hard, trying to rupture something. Shove him back into the wall. Drywall implodes. He squeals/shrieks, seizes his shoulder. WILHITE                                  *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I outrank you Klein! Are you out of                 * your mind? Brass knucks gleam, get close, kow him completely. ME                                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fingered Tommy for his father's                 * disappearance and pressed me to do                  * the same to cover your ass!                         * WILHITE                                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was the prime suspec-                            * ME                                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -he was screaming about `set-ups,'                  * and about how a `Cop' killed Hector                 * --he thought I was you Wilhite. (get closer, growl this) The gray Packard that gunned him                    * down showed up three minutes after                  * my dispatch call...                                 * WILHITE                                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -so cops killed him too, is that                    * the kind of bullshit you wa-                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ME                                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -not just cops. Narcotics Cops. You                   * clip Hector, then his kid becomes                     * collateral & you gotta clip him too.                                                  * WILHITE                                     *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -you're paddlin' air pal.                             * ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I? Where's Hector? You can't file murder charges without a corpse. Who knows this? Cops know this- You would know this. WILHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -I'm going to the review board and have you cited for- -keep him off balance. Big curveball- ME                                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -When'd Hector start pimping                          * Lucille?                                              * Read it: that stung him... WILHITE                                     *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What-                                                 * ME                                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --When did he start whoring out his                   * own daughter to sweeten business                      * deals?                                                * WILHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no fucking idea what you're- ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -he ever offer her to you?                            * Watch his face. Something flickers. WILHITE                                     *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm married!                                          * ME                                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And about to be divorced. Have you                    * ever fucked Lucille?                                  * Stare it out of him...already pink features go fuchsia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care where you get your                         * dick wet Wilhite. I care that                           * you're covering. Twenty years dirty                     * with this fucked-up family...your                       * secrets must stink like rot.                            * Red and blue light strobe from outside. Look: an unmarked caravan arrives. Bradley leading the charge, leaping from sedan. Wilhite gets a split-second's worth of gloat/glee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're worried about every wrong                        * thing Klein. Bradley's tee'ing you                      * up to take a big fat fall-                              *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -then we'll hold hands on the way                       * down: look further up the street.                       * (directing his gaze)                                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Black Buick.                                        * Wilhite focuses, sees the Feds inside, snapping pictures the Magdalena home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feds. They're all over this. You                        * think I'm the only one that burns?                      * Two decades worth of twisted shit                       * between your division and the                           * biggest dope dealer in LA?                              * Wilhite wide-eyed. Slouching/sinking down onto the toilet Somebody beating on the bathroom door hard. Bradley's voi behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I'm going down Dan...that's                      * the difference between you and me.                      * Open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoulder past, start down the stairs. Bradley follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klein!                                                  * Hit the front door, moving toward my car, Junior and the Narco brims cagey, primed for another atomic outburst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bradley still behind -- a prissy, patrician gait as he catches up -- spooked by that Black Buick up the street. BRADLEY (CONT'D)                             *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said `no direct approach!'                           * ME                                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (my back still turned)                             * Then what are you doing here?                          * BRADLEY                                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were instructed to take Tommy                      * Magdalena alive. Do I have to                          * remind you of the coroner's file-                      * ME                                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turn on him, fierce)                              * -enough of your `Sanderline'                           * bullshit.                                              * (nod to the Black Buick)                           * I'll checkmate with an admission of                    * guilt to Noonan himself.                               * BRADLEY                                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharp, shrill)                                    * Keep your voice down!                                  * ME                                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bargain immunity in exchange                      * for testimony on how the LAPD                          * really runs: Magdalena dope profit                     * kickbacks, Diskant run out of the                      * city council race on your word,                        * suspended cops pulling shakedowns.                     * I'll give Noonan a dozen new probes                    * for the one I killed.                                  * Bradley stoic, assessing me...sees only `fuck-you' resolv BRADLEY                                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm assuming command of this                           * investigation myself.                                  * ME                                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What investigation? Tommy's murder?                    * Hector's disappearance? What are                       * you investigating?                                     * BRADLEY                                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on one month's unpaid leave                     * as of this moment.                                     * Go right at him, cut his steam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're scamming something big.                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -if you make any further inquiries                   * into this case I'll strip you of                     * rank, have your pension revoked and                  * walk that coroner's file into the                    * Times myself...stay away from this.                  * See red. Launch. Try to wrap my hands around his throat. Watch him feather back just out of reach. Junior and a pa of six-packs restrain me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your fucking angle Bradley!?                  * His eyes beam back doom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're done Klein. Soon.                             *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reach the car, slide in, anger in aftershocks rattle acro still balled fists. Junior at my window blathering white noise. He might as well be speaking Greek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave listen: don't do anything else                  * to jeopardize yourself...I can                       * protect you...I've been putting                      * some things together-                                * Rip my radio, punch the call button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Central, this is Klein, I need an update on that overdose I called in. What's the girl's condition? Static. Wait. Anger make my eyes ache, fuzz my focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Klein, the girl, Tilda Hopwell was pronounced D.O.A. at Hollywood Presbyterian Hospital- Rage flares, slam the radio into the dash console, crushi it- fists flex, blood seeps from a battered knuckle, look my hands: blood drool over the faint remains of the pen- scrawled `A I N G E'...Glare up at Junior:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (God-like import)                                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George Ainge's address.                                 *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up the walk, Junior tailing, feel his stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in no state to conduct yourself as a Police Offic-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -shut up. Don't identify yourself,                      * don't badge him, don't talk.                            * BLACK. Then a light turns on somewhere: my gun in a round man's face just through his front door. GEORGE AINGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough Ainge: He doesn't flinch. Drops his lunch-pail slow Takes off his jacket: jail-house tattoos abound. He sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know Glenda Bledsoe?                         * Junior's `betrayed' look: this guy is tied to that Cooze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knew that whore'd try to muscle me-                     *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -don't call her a whore again.                          * Laughs in my face:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you gave her as many paychecks                       * as me, you'd know `whore' fits                          * like a fuckin glov-                                     * -I grab a chair cushion, put the .45 against it, fire a muffled round that blows Ainge's hair back as it passes. Junior twitches hard enough to spot himself. Ainge jabber

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fucked for a fee! Jesus Christ                      * she's a pro! What is she paying to                      * get that blade back-                                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -get the gun in his face, burn his nose with the barrel. ME                                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What `blade?'                                    * GEORGE AINGE                                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she paying you to recover                       * her knife? Just then Junior banana peels it -- deliberately: JUNIOR STEMMONS                              *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant!                                            * A hate-scowl for Junior: trying to put enough heat behind to melt his head. Ainge lights up. GEORGE AINGE                                 *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all are Cops!?                                       * ME                                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your mouth.                                       * Ainge sees me bent on Glenda. Looks past me, past the gun his face, aims right at Junior. GEORGE AINGE                                 *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in `50, Glenda the Good Witch                     * put a blade in her pimp `bout as                       * deep as I put my pink in her, this                     * mongrel named Dwight Gillette.                         * Junior fixes me, pulls that steno, starts scribbling open I grab it, shred it. Ainge grins at the voodoo between us GEORGE AINGE (CONT'D)                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could use a couple LAPD favors, and                    * ain't guttin' a pimp still a crime?                    * JUNIOR STEMMONS                              *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aimed at ME)                                      * Capitol crime.                                         * GEORGE AINGE                                 *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess who she asked to hold the                        * knife? Guess why she brought me in                     * on this kidnap thing? It was her                       * way a' buying it back-                                 * ME                                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -show it to me.                                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGE AINGE                                 *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have my lawyer take a picture                     * of it for you-                                         * -throw his TV at his head: legitimately trying to kill hi now and he knows it. Off his chair, crawling. JUNIOR STEMMONS                             *

dialogues.speaker: STOP
dialogues.text: (more question than                                * statement)                                       *

dialogues.speaker: YOU ARE NOT BENT ON AN EX-WHORE
dialogues.text: I grab the shattered tube: throw it again. Big POP inches from Ainge. Angry at myself for missing twice: ME                                           *

dialogues.speaker: GOD DAMN IT-
dialogues.text: JUNIOR STEMMONS                              *

dialogues.speaker: -HE'S A MATERIAL WITNESS TO A MURD-
dialogues.text: -grab Junior, sharp jab him, push him out a door for the second time- JUNIOR STEMMONS (CONT'D)                     *

dialogues.speaker: -YOU WILL CEASE AND DESIST KLEIN-
dialogues.text: -final push with my foot gives me enough room to dead-bol behind him. Ainge can't fit under his bed. GEORGE AINGE                                 *

dialogues.speaker: I AIN'T RESISTING YOU
dialogues.text: ME                                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not arresting you.                                 * Flip the mattress. Teen Tit mags and jack-off socks fly w it. Ainge under pine slats. Panic. I put my foot through, bash his gut -- rip him out from underneath. ME (CONT'D)                                  *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hissing)                                          * Where is it?                                           * Ainge unable to speak, gasping for air. Step to his close shred hinges when I open it. Rip the clothes rod down: nothing. Pull shelves from the wall: a Louisville Slugger falls at my feet. I smile. Ainge goes frightwig. Step to ME (CONT'D)                                  *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swing it into a wall. Gaping holes in holster. Bring it b like Babe Ruth over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -that blade or your life.                              * Door bashed open behind me -- deadbolt assembly pops, pie hit me -- then something big/black-metallic ends my night Junior, tear-streaked cheeks, Ainge's mailbox in-hand, pu free from the stucco. I drop. Ainge turns cheerleader:

dialogues.speaker: NICE
dialogues.text: Roll to my knees: guttural groans I can't place   because they're mine. Junior rips a radio cord from the   wall, w it around my neck, pulls my head back, feel his   tears h shoulders. Veins in his arms go Pop. Eyes in my   head go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time you push me out a door!                      * For a dirty split-tail! You're-                        * (cinches hard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -not dragging me down! If Bradley doesn't get you, Noonan will! And- (through gritted-teeth)                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -you're gonna burn all by yourself! -go black. Then eyes open...out for hours/days/months...w Feel. Hangman's bruise forming around my neck. Junior and Ainge gone. Floorboards under Ainge's bed pried-up. Crawl the hole: a hiding spot, empty of whatever was in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it: the knife was here. Ainge                     * was crawling under his bed not to                      * escape me, but to hand it over. Too                    * hate-wired to see it.                                  * I check my watch: 11 PM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior the Player. Junior the                          * Underestimated. Junior the Former                      * Evidence Teacher: a murder weapon,                     * a witness, a two-hour head-start.                      *

dialogues.speaker: EXT. AINGE'S PLACE
dialogues.text: Few looks from few neighbors. No sirens. Thank God gunsho and screams are school-nights in this slum. Get into my c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My glove box ripped open, contents gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior the Flush: my $5000 down-                      * payment from Hughes gone. Junior                      * the Merciful: He should've put a                      * bullet in my brain.                                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody around this late. Only a desk sergeant on the doze Zero-in on Junior's desk, search it: files squared, penci in precise alignment, evidence books arrayed alphabetical

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything inspection neat. No                        * mail, no personal items. Eagle                        * scout perfect.                                        * Rip at a locked return, jimmy the desk drawers, feel the underside for a key -- zilch. Slide under, looking...noth Sit up, grab his phone, dial out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?                                                 *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg wake up Pete.                                     *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Jesus Christ...                                    * Rustling and whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take some pills, will you?                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you a grand to locate and                   * tail Junior Stemmons.                                 *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your partner?                                         * Find a letter opener, fuck it -- pry the drawer loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Past tense.                                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two grand.                                           * Pop. The lock snaps. Ease it open... ME                                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done. Tell me what he does, who he                   * talks to, where he goes, and if                      * he's got this mutt named George                      * Ainge stashed somewhere.                             * Look inside. Red steno pads. A small orderly pile. Pull o thumb it-- blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. PETE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Stemmons' address? ME                                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on it.                                   * Hang up. Voices arrive. Hustle to my desk, sit, grab a reverse directory, fake flip through it as Fritz Koenig a two Robbery Blueshirts arrive, seizure bags over their shoulders. I clear sweat and leftover blood with my sleev trying to look busy as Koenig sidles up. ME (CONT'D)                                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nod to shoulder bag)                            * You moonlighting? KOENIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing some ad hoc dope seizures for Dan Wilhite. (that shark grin) Still love taking the occasional door down. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were born for the street Fritz. I never featured you for the suit and tie set. KOENIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're of a common bloodline Boy-o. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get that haul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KOENIG                                     *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dropping bag)                                   * Some reformed spic dope dealers                      * that normally dabble in reefer.                      * Koenig, his knuckles and fingernails caked with blood, pu a three-pound brick of heroin from the bag. KOENIG (CONT'D)                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seized from Chavez Ravine. Thirty                    * pounds. The City is cracking down                    * on the dreaded to make room for                      * their beloved Dodgers. They remove                   * the Mexicans, we remove the rest.                    * Scramble a joke to keep Koenig from looking at me too closely... ME                                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? They could hawk heroin right                    * along with peanuts and hot dogs.                     * Have the whole bleacher section                      * goofing on horse.                                    * Koenig laughs big, re-shoulders the bag. KOENIG                                     *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new found dedication these days?                   * What's prompting such odd hours?                     * ME                                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Playing catch-up.                                    * KOENIG                                     *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy Chief seems to be running                    * both of us ragged.                                   * ME                                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He currying favor with Chief Parker with this Chavez Ravine sweep? KOENIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker appreciates Bradley's political skills...and the addition of a professional Ball-club to our fare city fulfills his own personal mandate of a cleaner, brighter, LA. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds boring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stale milk to me too. And how are you faring? Is our visiting U.S. Attorney still in hot pursuit? Look up. Let him see it in my face: humorless and half li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borrowed time Fritz.                                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything I can do?                                     *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...a small favor.                                  * (beat)                                             *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stemmons home address if you have                      * it. He's in a bit of a bind.                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bigger than your own?                                  *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot bigger.                                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop loose change. Dial. Pete picks up on the first ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3160 Rossmore. Apartment #6.                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you want me to clip Stemmons?                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. By now, he's stashed                          * Ainge, so he's travelling solo.                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this `Ainge' clown anyway?                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not important.                                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Milteer wants a progress report                    * on the Movie Broad -- Bledsoe-                         * -hang up. Roll to my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late. Pull in, plop the dishrag loaded with ice on the fr seat. Blood still seeping, slick it back in my hair. Step from the car-- woozy/weaving, the goose-egg on my head fe like a hand grenade. Up the front walk, lean on the doorbell. She answers, Sil chemise barring tan shoulders, her hair swept up a long, perfect neck. If she just woke up, she doesn't look it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could say something witty about                       * "gentleman callers at this hour,                        * covered in blood" but--                                 * No time to trade repartee. Out with it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George Ainge.                                           * She goes rigid, clutches her robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that his?                                            * (off my nod `yes')

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he dead?                                             *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But I know about Dwight                             * Gillette and the knife you're                           * trying to barter back. All of it.                       * Like I punched her in the mouth. Her face: embarrassment with confusion. She recovers quick, steels herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are you here? Y'should be                      * picking up a paycheck from Hughes.                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not watching you for him                            * anymore.                                                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're planning on shaking me                        * down for `favors,' go pick-up your                      * paycheck Mr. Klein. Or are you                          * being a policeman right now?                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The good ones are called                                * `Policemen.' The bad ones are                           * called `Cops.' I'm a Cop.                               * She steps closer. I can smell her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another `cop' has this information                      * on you. He has the murder weapon                        * too. He might use it against you                        * before I can stop him. Can you go                       * somewhere?                                              *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're protecting me? You don't                         * even know me...                                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the parts you wish I didn't.                       * The place in Topanga Canyon where                       * your going to hole up for the                           * kidnapping thing. Is it safe?                           * She nods, drifts somewhere, a part of her life thought de threatening everything again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your coat.                                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving. Glenda close. I want to pull her closer. We wind along Topanga Canyon. Constant mirror checks, looking for Packards/Buicks/Ghosts...seeing nothing...I roll my windo up. Light jazz on the radio gives way to the news:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -KGFJ news at the top of the hour.                      * U.S. Attorney Welles Noonan today                       * announced his intention to probe                        * what he called `widespread                              * corruption' within the Los Angeles                      * Police Department and promised an                       * equally widespread round of                             * criminal indictments before-                            * -click it off. Abrupt. She notices, says nothing. After another half mile she points to a side road: 655 TOPANGA RD on the mailbox. I pull in. A gravel drive gives way to bungalow, tucked into the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Ainge know about this place?                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I didn't want to tell him till                      * after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.                                                   * Put the car into `park.' Idle. She looks over, her eyes asking something. I hold her gaze, hesitate, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's going to happen to you...                     * She frets with her hair, her eyes glassy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know that.                                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna let it.                                   * A beat...I want to grab her and kiss her. I convince myse otherwise, grab a card from my coat and a pen, scrawl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my sister's number. Name is                     * Meg. Call if there are problems.                        * Hand her the card. We touch. I linger. So does she.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving. Blood-shot. Slowly being squeezed on all sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for leverage. Figure out Bradley's angle before I fry. Madge and Lucille in custody. No Hector and no Tommy equals No leads. Save one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slouched in my front seat, watching a small flop-style mo near the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan Wilhite. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dispatch shot me his temporary address. Some beach flop he fled to after his wife put him out. Check my Hamilton: 7:32 AM. A car pulls into the parking Two suits step out, ramrod straight, starched officious: Process Servers if ever I've seen them. One of them bears sealed envelope as they walk to room #11 and knock. No answer. They knock rude. I roll down my window. Dan Wilhite answers in a robe: Groggy-pissed-hungover. Be he utters a word, he's handed the sealed envelope and the pair depart. Wilhite calls after, tearing open the envelo and reading what's inside...then rereading it. Gauge his reaction: ruined. He puts his hand on top of his head...like he's trying to protect it from the sky that is now falling down around h Another big pause staring at nothing...then he just calml walks back inside the room, closing the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of my car. Quietly hustling up to Wilhite's door: Rea it and hear a distinct POP -- see the flash-snap from beh the curtains: Gunshot. I know what it is. Hit the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilhite's service revolver a foot away from one hand, a s of paper still gripped in the other. Body half onto the b half off. Blood drains from a round wound in his temple. Check behind me, nobody coming- close the hotel door. Pic the sheet of paper/contents of the envelope. The first wo see: SUBPOENA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My first thought, pure panic: Noonan figured the Narco-Magalena connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip the Subpoena over to see his Signature: not Noonan's This subpoena has been issued and signed by LA District Attorney Bob Gallaudet. Flip it back over, wide-eyed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it wasn't a Federal Subpoena. Wilhite was being called to testify by Bob Gallaudet, a man who doesn't piss without Bradley's say-so. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bradley trying to beat Noonan to the punch and burn the LAPD himself...why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quick check of the lot. Empty. A housekeeping cart sits nearby. Swipe a bottle of bleach from it. Walk to Wilhite Studebaker Powerhawk. Pop the trunk, return to his room. Move quick. Fireman's carry, dump Wilhite's body in the trunk. Toss his service .38 too. Pour the bottle of bleac stanch the inevitable rot smell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swap my car for Wilhite's. The former head of the LAPD's Narcotics division dead in the trunk. Call it the leverage I was looking for -- his body can buy me out of bad spot- -and that's when I see it: a bandage poking out from unde Wilhite's collar...undo a couple buttons, lift the bandag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM: me hit from behind by the Peeper. BAM: me firing at Peeper. Hit him in the left shoulder. BAM: Grabbing Wilhi shoulder in the Magdalena bathroom, him howling in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kind of wound a grazed bullet leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilhite was the Peeper. Bent on                        * Lucille, a girl younger than his                       * youngest daughter. Call it grounds for divorce...Call Wilhite Hector Magdalena's murderer... Slam the trunk as Wilhite's glazed eyes stare back at me. 70   EXT. STREET - A.M. Slow cruise, new ride means no tails. Check my mirrors anyway. Back to the pad, back-streets all the way. 71   INT. MY HOME, HOLLYWOOD HILLS - A.M. Rounding the corner -- break hard: those same process ser leaning on my doorbell now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bradley trying to bury me too. That subpoena means my fifteen year career with the LAPD just went up in smoke. Continue past. Those Process Geeks keep buzzing my doorbe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop dimes. Dial Pete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Junior's left the fucking planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I swung by his apartment, car was out front. I scoped it: a sawed- off shotgun in front, canned tuna in the back seat. Think he's living outta that car. After he left, I tried to get inside his place: The front door is triple pad-locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That knife is in there-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -the what? Shit. Ignore it, maybe Pete will too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet me down the street from his place. You got bolt cutters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bring `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior's stucco-beige apartment building looms a block up Cursory checks of the rear and side-view mirrors. Sans ta as I pull the Powerhawk in behind Pete's Caddy. Step out, sidle up driver's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's car is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior looked real skeezed this morning. Like he was on a dope jag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweated up like a stuck pig. And be careful. He was fucking around with his front door before he left. I don't know what he was doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two honks if he shows. Then meet me in the alley, back of his place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing me bolt-cutters)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about this Bledsoe broad? Milteer has called me twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the bolt-cutters)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing at a time pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hustle across the street. Hang my badge over my shirt-poc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up three flights. Junior: #303: three padlocks:hinge/rece hardware extending between door and jamb. Three kicks and shoulder to splinter the door. Stop, look: Some kind of t stretched taut, just inside the door...trip-wire. Pull my sticker, extend it between door and jamb...see the twine stretching tighter -- flick the blade, snag twine, slice Stand. Put my boot into the door full. Snaps at the hinge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move slow. Examine close: Eye-bolt pulley system, jerry- rigged around the door. Severed twine attached to the tri of a shotgun taped atop a jello mold at knee level. Continue to look around. Sex-horror grimace: like catchin Pop fingering Mom. Junior's place a tiny, filthy one bedr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior the Insane: You couldn't hide what he was hiding in 1958 LA, and not have it rot your mind. Bear traps barely hidden under sheets. Rat-traps garnishe with razor blades across the floor. Smell rotten flowers: shirt that I wore/bled-on crumpled on his pillow -- yello jizz stains cover black blood stains. Stifle a gag. Card table: an empty green-banded evidence bag. Gape at i Then walk over, read the abstracts: 1284 South Tremaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior stealing evidence from the Magdalena crime scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I see the bookcase. Top shelf: Police manuals. Botto two shelves: wall-to-wall red steno-pads, all exactly the same brand. Shock. Step over. Flip through them: tiny, architect-neat script covers every page. The running dial of a functional fucking freak:

dialogues.speaker: LACK OF INTEREST.
dialogues.text: A hand drawn cock doodled beneath that, then below:

dialogues.speaker: DAVE WEARING FORM-FITTING SHIRT TODAY. HANDSOME. I WANT T
dialogues.text: -drop the steno like it might bite. Pick up another: same drill.

dialogues.speaker: WITH POISON PILL KLEIN. MAKE HIM PAY FOR PATRONIZING ME.
dialogues.text: Pick up yet another, hands shaking, turn to the last page MAKE KLEIN HURT LIKE I HURT. TRADE HIM. TRADE EVERYTHING.

dialogues.speaker: DREAM DOWN, 10,000 TO GO
dialogues.text: ME (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior the Climber, trading me up to Noonan. Thinks bootlicking will buy him a Bureau gig. Now, rifle for that knife. Systemically destroy the place Dump the stenos in a trash can, sift for matches, strike, watch the pads catch and floosh, feed the fire with rando paperwork, sift -- Junior's cock-obsessed doodles scribbl by the dozen. Under the bed now, carpet covered in rat-traps. Spring th clear a space. A Box: beefcake booty, gay smut mags, gay classified ads. First-person perspective Polaroids of Junior's stomach being kissed by the Diskant Quiff and vi versa. Open a massive steamer trunk against a far wall. Arsenal: handguns, shotguns, a surplus M-1. Dump it, kick contents Only interested in that knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move into his kitchenette. Check the freezer even though Junior is smarter than that: amyl-nitrate poppers, vodka, benzedrine, cocaine. Close it. Look down. STOP: indents i the cheap tile floor from where the refrigerator used to Pull to see what's behind. Eyes catch the bear-trap near bed as I tug: ugly-rusted-waiting. STOP part II: Contort, peer behind the refrigerator: a pineapple-shaped hand gre duct-taped to the wall, next to a built-in safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The safe scared me more than all of it because a safe doesn't get installed overnight...he'd been working on something, planning something... Twine leads from the grenade's pin to the back of the refrigerator. My bolt-cutters snap it. Pull the refrigera out now. The safe bolted into the drywall. Stare at it: t dial, the black paint-job...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loading shells into the shotgun that was atop that jello mold. Back into the kitchen. Exhale. BEGIN BLASTING. Mass noise. Six shots. Reload fast: nothing can muffle this clatter. SECOND VOLLEY. Eyes closed to keep chunks of dry out. Gagging on gunsmoke. Rip at the safe -- something gi THIRD VOLLEY. The Safe hits the floor, leaves a hole. Through the ringing in my ears: something that sounds lik honks. Quick peek: Pete gone. A Black Buick with two whit walled FEDS up front. Then Junior gets out of the backsea Scoop the freezer drugs, the stack of man-porn, the snapshots, and toss a whole armful into the hallway in fr of Junior's door. Grab the green-banded evidence bag and it under my arm. Back into the kitchenette. Turn on the g but don't light the burners. Pull the grenade off the wal Drag the safe to the rear of his place: the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out the window, on the escape, toss the evidence-bag down Pete, then push the safe over the railing. Feature it alm crush the back of Pete's idling Cadillac. Pete jumps, yel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it open if you can and meet me back at Meg's! Doesn't move until I pull the pin on the pineapple, drop pin down on him. He jumps back in, peels off-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Junior on the second-floor landing, heading to his place Bloodshot bleary wide eyes, spun on a combo of drugs, the Feds herding him like a rabid dog:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay right here. I'll get it all and come back. Don't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricochet the grenade back into the kitchen. Leap down hal flight: put exterior brick between my head and the- -BIG BOOM -- the grenade goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior knocked on his ass halfway up the last flight. Fed come sprinting. Screaming Junior tackles one on the way u Juniors' front-door blown off. Terrified Neighbors greete with images of Sodom scattered from the explosion: drugs, mags, dildos. The Fed that didn't get tackled picks up a photo: Junior kissing a hairy stomach. And Junior's mind snaps cleanly in-half. Crawls away grow like a bear caught in one of his traps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I step calm. Clear the alley slow. Don't let your stride you away. Another Black Buick arrives. More Bureau stiffs Keep moving. Looky-Loos pop up along the block, pointing. the only one not looking back toward Junior's now flaming pad. The Powerhawk still another street up. Fire engines close. Shouts from behind now. Look back: a Bureau putz pointing way -- one of the Buicks tearing up the block toward me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it. Keep going and give up Wilhite's car and the corpse inside, or lay back and deal with Noonan's Buzzcuts. Lace my fingers behind my head, turn to face them -- catc form tackle from this geeked up junior G-Man diving from Buick, drives his shoulder and takes me down sprawling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welles Noonan staring. He picks nipped/mutilated fingerna

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Civil servants can't afford manicures?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breaking and entering, theft, and willful destruction of private property...and I'll add attempted murder to the current first degree murder charge I'm about to file against you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proof. If you had it, you wouldn't be fucking around with shitty shakedown routine -- you'd file. Coercion equals confession. So let's see you pound it out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the files you stole from Sergeant Richard Stemmons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior. Your secret weapon right? I mean, I know J. Edgar is a slanted fuck, but traditionally `vicious fags' don't make the best major case witnesses. (beat, keep pushing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried those burning dildos may have damaged his credibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I don't need his testimony Klein. I'll just force yours.

dialogues.speaker: ME
dialogues.text: Not if you had the next hundred years.

dialogues.speaker: WELLES NOONAN
dialogues.text: Sanderline Johnson, your links to Sam Giancana to Mickey Cohen, extortion, bribes, murder-for-hire. I'll put you in every pair of cross- hairs I can find. I'll torch everything you've ever touched. You have no idea how deep I run Klein. And how far I'm willing to go to fuck you-

dialogues.speaker: ME
