dialogues.text: -everyone knows I'm a piece-a-shit. What are you proving? Bradley's the guy flanking you right now. The guy who's vulnerable right now.

dialogues.speaker: WELLES NOONAN
dialogues.text: You're all angles and graft Klein. Why trust a God damn word that comes out of your-

dialogues.speaker: ME
dialogues.text: -you done anything with the Magdalena case?

dialogues.speaker: WELLES NOONAN
dialogues.text: (thrown) Prelims: drug pusher gone missing, presumed dead, we're investigat-

dialogues.speaker: ME
dialogues.text: (scoffing) -Dealing drugs for 20 years! Arrested once. Hall a' fame career! You photographed the head of Narco in-front of his house...

dialogues.speaker: ME
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, you need cue cards? (sell this fucker now) Come after me: you get me. Go after what I can give you and you get the LAPD's power-set on a slab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WELLES NOONAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you'd turn. Treacherous yes, traitorous no. Tell me where Stemmons' files are. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bring them to you. WELLES NOONAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not leaving here Klein. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then like I said: you only get me. Noonan stands, firm: WELLES NOONAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take it. On his way out I speak fast -- the last ace in my deck: ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give you the body of Dan Wilhite, head of LAPD's Narcotics Division. Proof of a 20-year criminal collusion between his department and Hector Magdalena and my testimony to link the dots. (beat, make him believe) Then I leave LA for good. Noonan at the door: please bite-please bite...but he just smirks, walks out. Real panic now: no ideas on what comes next. 15 seconds. Door opens again: one of Noonan's deput pushes a sheet. Scan it: Federal Witness Agreement. Noona back: two cups of coffee. Read it over. WELLES NOONAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Wilhite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suicide. WELLES NOONAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Sanderline Johnson? Ignore him. Sign the agreement. WELLES NOONAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me Stemmons files and Wilhite's body by noon tomorrow. Gulp the coffee back, the burn feels good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more tails. I don't want anyone else incriminated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agreed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nod to agreement)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get a copy of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a judge signs it. Now Leave. Stand-nod-take my coffee-leave. Door closes. Noonan shred the Witness agreement. Tosses it in the trash. Off the baffled Deputy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wait for him to deliver, then we arrest him. You never saw that agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tail him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Let him get comfortable...let him believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backseat. Suborned Cabby driving fast. LAPD on board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running out of room, time, both. Trapped between Bradley and Noonan. Jump out of the cab, into Wilhite's Powerhawk. Slide in, the door.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MEG'S PLACE
dialogues.text: Bust in shaking. Teeth chatter like I'm freezing. Pete in garage adjacent the kitchen, welder's goggles and a power drill, punching holes in Junior's safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what Feds look like -- those were Feds with Junior...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah and they made me leaving the scene. Had to barter out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barter what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Testimony. I signed a Federal Witness Agreement. Pete drops the drill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bullshit. Noonan's got no intention of honoring it. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want Stemmons files though. I think Junior's been working angles for awhile, doing his own investigations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do to his place? Nice quiet neighborhood one minute, Nagasaki the next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (point to safe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had a hand grenade tied to that. (as Pete resumes drilling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much longer do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Few more hours. Maybe. Junior didn't skimp on this thing. I gotta bore right through the face plate. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got some time now, why don't you get Milteer off my back and go work that Bledsoe broad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You read my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull in. Glenda's Vette parked behind. Lights on low insi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. She's dressed for bed. I don't hesitate, afraid she'll shun me. Move to her, she doesn't startle. arm around her waist, drawing her in, my mouth close to h I take her face in my hand, check her eyes, a beat before they tell me it's okay...I lean in, takes a lifetime...an kiss her soft until she kisses back, her mouth moving ove split lips, she puts her hands on my face, pulling me in. She feels exactly like I imagined. My coat comes off. Her camisole follows. We're moving tow a bed in back. I stop, pull back, the moonlight moves ove her shoulders. I whisper:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...tell me if I'm being too rough. Tears squeezed through smiling eyes, she kisses me even harder, pulls me down to her. We make love like we've nev touched another. Everything blurs, burns down: Bradley. Wilhite. Tommy. Hector Junior. Ainge. She takes it all aw I escape into her. Hours fall. I could stay here forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying there, staring at her. A silence and peace I've nev known. Not once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me anything. Tell me everything. Label her surprise, her brow that furrows and unfurrows j as quickly. A long moment as she waivers...commits:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where would I start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why L.A.? (this amazing smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is anybody here? Want the rest of the world to know who they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You? GLENDA BLEDSOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...I don't think so. (beat) I just love it. I grew up in Seattle. My aunt, every week, she'd take me to the movies. Me watching her...tucks her hair back over his shoulders. GLENDA BLEDSOE (CONT'D)                     *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The idea that you can outlive yourself...that a part of you goes on, long after you're gone. (beat, grins) Sounds silly doesn't it? `Attack of the Atomic Vampires' being- ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -your ticket to immortality? Make her laugh. Swear a thousand silent oaths to protect He face slowly goes dark. GLENDA BLEDSOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hughes told me he could get me in for this screen test two years ago. Movie with Gregory Peck at Universal. He thought he was humoring me...until I got it. They offered me the role...there in the room. So Howard, who I'm sure never thought in a million years I'd land that part, makes some phone calls and just like that they don't want me anymore. (beat) Nobody calls now. I can't get in to see any studio casting people. He's ruined me in those circles. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you still want it- GLENDA BLEDSOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -bad enough to put on a silly cheerleading skirt and try to make the most god-awful dialogue sound decent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surrounded by winos in werewolf suits. (she laughs, I laugh) That's...dedication. GLENDA BLEDSOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or desperation. Depends on the day. The laughter ebbs, her eyes still shine. GLENDA BLEDSOE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get there though. (beat) I'll get there. I let the silence take...try not to shatter it with: ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight Gillette. She doesn't blanch. GLENDA BLEDSOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked me to take his `niece and nephew' to their cousin in Oxnard. These beautiful, funny little kids. (tears she doesn't swipe) I dropped them off. Didn't ask any questions -- I believed Dwight. A week later I saw their pictures in the Post Office. A week after that their little bodies came in on the tide near San Pedro. (beat, tears stream) I'll never shake the thought that maybe those poor kids thought I was part of it. That I knew what was going to happen to them. So I pray to God that he let them look in when I put that knife into Dwight. (beat) But I'll never ask his forgiveness for doing it... (beat, clears her eyes) Why do they call you `Enforcer?' She actually gets closer, I can feel her breath on me. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've killed 44 men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She blanches, but never blinks...never takes her eyes awa from mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 33 for War. 2 for principle. 9 for profit -- mostly. Why did you sign with Hughes, knowing what he was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `For profit -- mostly.' Silence. A feeling like: `and there we are...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not much good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither. She touches my quake. Two breaths with her hand on mine a it all goes quiet: the shakes, the images, the fear. She takes my head, pulls me to her bare breasts. The only thi audible: my breathing, a clock ticking. Both slowly fade BLACK. Wake up quiet, look at my Hamilton. 6 AM. Sit up slow. Look back at her, sleeping, just stare. I lean down, kiss lightly, her taste lingers, inhale her, hold that...it's last good thing you'll get today. 88   INT. MEG'S HOUSE - EARLY A.M. Dark. Stay quiet. Maneuver into the kitchen. Turn on a li On the table: safe open, it's contents laid-out neatly, s stacks of files, $1000 in twenties. I sit, start searchin for something else...Pete's voice behind me:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Knife ain't there. File on top of that middle pile: George Ainge in an `undisclosed locale.' I don't turn. Pete sits next to me. Sets a shotgun down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior documented everything like a fucking Monk. (pulls a file)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like here: `has evidence' you murdered Sanderline Johnson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kept track of `suspected contract killings' you pulled for the mob. Look at Pete. Dark rings, deathbed eyes. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been up all night? PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In-case Stemmons made a house-call. He's got every goddamn address of everybody you know... (beat, hard) And you should've told me about the Bledsoe broad. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to tell. Feature Pete, righteously pissed: PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then call Milteer about this dead Pimp Gillette. I'm no legal mind like you, but I'll bet a murder beef would violate her morals clause quick. (beat, hands phone) Collect the rest of your money. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want it anymore. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then give that five grand back. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior stole it. Pete pauses, scoffs, turns back toward Meg's bedroom walk PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are gonna start lining-up to see you bleed, Pal. Door closes. I flip through Junior's files: the same architect-neat block printing. Find a Glenda entry: SUBSEQUENT TO HER FATAL STABBING OF DWIGHT Gillette, MISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shred it. Grab another file. Hyper-detailed: subscript clarifications, attachments, pictures, procedural notes t the U.S.A.W.N.: United States Attorney Welles Noonan. Then I see the tab of the file furthest down: BOYCE BRADL Open it: Noonan's business card stapled to the front cove Flip forward. Scan. See Bradley's name, finger tracks acr a page. A company name: `HURWITZ HOLDINGS' I read it all...and feel my jaw slowly unhinge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barrel down the hallway toward Bradley's office. A habitu eye toward Junior's desk: Koenig going through his drawer Stop. Veer toward him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (formal-frosty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your young partner called me at my home, early this morning. Teeth grit. Hide it. Let Koenig talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavily inebriated. Speaking inarticulately of `betrayal,' & how the LAPD was set to be `blitzed by justice.' Is this the `bind' of which we spoke earlier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And his apartment -- there was some type of disturbance? A fire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I needed his address. I was trying to help him before something like this happened. The kid snapped-in-half Fritz. He's literally lost it. (beat, deadpan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He say anything else to you? Koenig looks back at me. Give nothing away...one gesture doesn't read right and he'll know. He lets more seconds p than he should. Trying to shake me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only that he was in possession of materials that might deeply damage Chief Bradley...and yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said Fritz, he's flipped his lid. I don't want to go to Internal Affairs but I'm afraid Junior might've forced just that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me try to locate the lad first Dave. Be a shame to ruin such a young career so soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful Fritz. He's dangerous. Spin, press on toward Bradley's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fritz Koenig, the best inspector in the LAPD, digging. He'll find Junior and when he does he'll find Ainge...then Glenda... Reach Bradley's office, burst in. Empty. To his Secretary

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowns at my informality)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out at the Ravine Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Park the Powerhawk. Downwind. Out. Walking. Check my Hamilton: 12:10 PM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noonan's deadline lapsed ten minutes ago. An official fugitive from justice now. Down below, Bradley with Reuben Ruiz in-tow: glazed-fear, following him like he's handcuffed. PROTESTORS gather, placards hoisted, chants: "Dodgers, No! Mexico, Si!" The group gathers steam, supporters pack in, the chorus continues: "DODGERS NO! MEXICO SI!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ME (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bradley doing damage control, the forced relocation of the Ravine's immigrants has the press in a feeding frenzy. Reuben Ruiz forced along as the token Mexican mouthpiece. Reporters press. Bradley handles them with ease and aplom BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -this area has long been rife with crime and venality, but with a brand new Stadium, we can make this horrible blight a bright spot and give our Los Angeles Dodgers the home they deserve. (like Ruiz was an orphan) Reuben Ruiz can tell you of his travails growing up in this horrible slum and why now is the time to `Redeem The Ravine.' REPORTER #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Bradley, U.S. Attorney Noonan has promised to deliver surprise witnesses before the Federal Grand jury on- -Bradley, this brilliant rebuke: BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Welles Noonan is an unscrupulous hack politician whose smear campaign against us will fail, for he has grievously underestimated the moral rectitude of the Los Angeles Police Department. Then Bradley sees me. His press-friendly face contorts, t shift startling: if only a flashbulb could've framed it. shifts back from snarl to smile... BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now if you'll excuse me, I'll leave you with Reuben Ruiz. Ruiz begins his forced/coerced/do-it-or-we'll-fuck-you so story as Bradley steps away from the glare. I follow. Get right on his heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your subpoena hasn't caught up to me yet, Chief... Bradley spins back. ME (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hand him Junior's file) Hurwitz Holdings. Bradley blanches, buckles. I see it. Before he can play stupid with: `What?' ME (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, Bethune, and Gallaudet bought big chunks of Chavez Ravine over the past two years through a shell company called Hurwitz Holdings. (beat, look around) If the Dodgers move here the value of the land booms...you could sell it off for a fortune -- or hang onto it and make even more. The parking lots alone would make you all multi-millionaires. Bradley removes his glasses, staring at documentation tha dooms both his immediate and distant future... ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Word gets out that the three City Officials who were pushing hardest for a Stadium also stood to gain a mint -- might color public opinion. Might color it even more to know that the LAPD's Chief of Detectives was trying to purchase a huge tract of that land from the biggest dope dealer in town. Slap another file over the one he's reading. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector Magdalena owned ten and half acres of this land. (beat, ram him) You didn't give a shit about solving his disappearance. You were worried that your real estate deal was going south. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ME (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you wanted Tommy found, not because he was a murder suspect or you were concerned that Noonan might tap him as a federal witness...you needed him to finalize your fucking land grab. To sign paperwork in place of his dead Dad. That's why you've got Madge and Lucille in custody now. (beat) Maybe I'll let your subpoena find me now Chief, maybe I'll walk right into it...the tales I could tell. All Bradley can muster is: BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior Stemmons. The ex-evidence teacher. His `excellent ratings' didn't stop him from stealing the Magdalena seizure and doing his own investigation. BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would he investigate me? Hand him Noonan's business card: dig the big Federal Eagl American Blue. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was stapled to the cover. (beat) Why would Noonan worry about a Turd like me now...when a high profile target like you can be taken down. Silence. I smile wide at it. Bradley, scrambling. BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Stemmons? ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea. If you haven't spoken to Internal Affairs today, I'm sure they've called. Junior's apartment caught fire. Deeply deviant material inside. Round him up- (my angle) -and anyone he's got with him. Bradley readjusts his glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll issue an A.P.B. saying Stemmons is a known deviant targeting kindergarten children. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, quid pro quo...you subpoenaed Wilhite too. Bradley's reaction: Feature the angler getting angled. BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do y- ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -don't worry `how.' Why? Bradley says nothing. Then, like a klieg-light, it hits m ME (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going after Narco yourself. BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exposing the corrupt parts of the LAPD will redeem the whole. I'll prove that Police can police themselves- ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -so you show-up Noonan...co-opt his crusade and condemn your own before he can...Jesus Christ can you turn lemons to lemonade. BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Cop will testify against other Cops. This is why Wilhite has suddenly disappeared. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how. (beat) So where do we go now Chief? BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, eyes flick again to the files I'm holding...) There are other forces at work here...faces we need to identify. Names we need to know. A third party. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRADLEY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find out who Klein and I'll reinstate you, rescind that subpoena & burn the coroner's report on Sanderline-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -that report is only useful to Noonan now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It ensures our mutual destruction should you choose to share the contents of that Stemmons file. Which I know you won't do until you figure out how it will best benefit you. He walks off, imperious, impervious, gets engulfed by the press ranks once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mistake to underestimate me now Chief. The price to keep your secrets is steep...and you're going to pay up. Soon. Back to the Powerhawk, fresh-scrubbed six-packs standing it, the trunk stink ripe past the point of concealment. T see me, deferential nods. One squeaky wheel offers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something in your trunk smells to high hell Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead body. Laughter. Easily amused academy types. Brush by grinning, give `em an "Enforcer" story to tell the other rookies. I jump in the Powerhawk and tear off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borrowed time burning fast. My days are done. Only hours remain. Whatever moves I have left...make them now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going through files. Filling my own steno pad with scrawl Pete walks in from the garage, face bunched up, bit-lemon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking Christ. You can't keep that car in the garage, the smell's coming into the house. Meg wanders in, dressed for work. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the windows. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not gonna help. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still scribbling) Take a couple bottles of bleach, pour it over the trunk. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you got in there? ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My foreseeable future. MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to work. She kisses me on my head. I turn: ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You taking her? PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (God damn glowering) I'm taking her. Meg walks out. Pete lingers. I'm starting to sour him. No smart. He stares. I look up. ME (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hughes. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is almost over Pete -- I'll give Milteer the five-grand back. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll square it. It's my thing. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you made mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. A beat. Pete sketches me head to toe. PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look as bad as I've ever seen you. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things are as bad as they've ever been... Pete exhales. Stalks off. I keep scribbling. ME (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bradley's Third Party Theory. Everything linked: Wilhite, Magdalena, the Ravine...I've got my own theories...and the one that sticks is the one I pray I'm wrong about. Meg's phone blares, I answer it on reflex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klein. I hear rasp on the other end, hyperventilating, unhinged. JUNIOR STEMMONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOTHERFUCKER -- you better meet me! That Cooze you threw everything away for is still cooked! I got the knife. I got Ainge- Junior. Jesus. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get this number Junior? JUNIOR STEMMONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got everything on you! AND I'M

dialogues.speaker: GONNA USE IT
dialogues.text: ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -you're a broom-closet Queer. Your career is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUNIOR STEMMONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The knife for MY file on Bradley. I know you already burned that Whore's but don't think I can't re- do investigations. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You snitch to Noonan, then what? JUNIOR STEMMONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck Noonan. I got stronger Allies. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? The Soviets? JUNIOR STEMMONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet me in one hour with that file, Fern Dell Park- ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Where you used to snag fruits for Vice? A volunteer gig I'm guessing. JUNIOR STEMMONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be there with Bradley's file or I scratch your scabby Bitch. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, did the Feds dig your pad? The phone on the other end seems to break-in half. Hang u it rings a beat later. Junior still wanting to spar. Snag receiver, rip his shit: ME (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -I see anybody near there Junior, the deals off and I gift that file to Bradley to fuck you with- GLENDA BLEDSOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Dave? ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big beat) Glenda? He's got her. Junior. Sick. Evil. My mind cannibalizes it with "where-is-she-how-do-I-get-her-back" when: GLENDA BLEDSOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry...you gave me this number... He doesn't have her. A sigh so big, it steals all my air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who were you talking-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -no, no. It's nothing. I had a phone call, just before yours. A beat. Glenda in a chaise lounge on a small deck overloo the canyon. She sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it him? The Cop you were telling me about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to worry. I'm handling it. But I might send my friend Pete out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think it's safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd just rather have someone there with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you would've woken me up this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm better-looking in low light, I didn't want to blow it for myself. She laughs. Makes me smile despite my world caving-in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay by the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you. And I melt. Love-struck at possibly the worst fucking mom of my life. Hang up before your voice breaks. Grab a pen, scrawl for Pete, post it on the fridge magnet: `PETE: 655

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling green. Half-dirt, half-asphalt path. I scan for a back-up. Nothing. Junior already there. Astride like Gary Cooper. His eyes bloodshot from here. My gun riding quick draw style. The heft feels good. Unbutton my coat to show the file as I approach, tucked right behind my .45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the knife. Junior, this evil little curl. He turns. Follow him over small knoll: that Gray Packard, waiting. A silhouette beh the wheel. As we near it the lights come on, blind me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn your lights off...and just come out and talk to me...Fritz. A pause in the car, Junior looks at me like I'm Rasputin, divining answers from the marine-layer moving-in over LA. lights pop off and I hear a tired laugh coming from the c that we've all heard before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third Party Confirmed...I fucking knew it. Fritz Koenig steps out of the Packard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much with these sub-rosa things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a nod to the Packard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was Noonan tailing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bradley's greatest stroke was enlisting you to his side. Junior, jumpy in my periphery. I don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilhite ran Magdalena for you, not Narco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't. I had a feeling. I smelled cover-up all over Hector's disappearance and Wilhite wouldn't have the muscle or the mind-set to kingpin something that big by himself...you knew about Bradley trying to buy him out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was offering to exonerate Hector and clear his criminal record. Hector met with Wilhite and I to inform us of his decision...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first and only time, WE SEE Hector Magdalena, ali and well...for the moment...speaking to Koenig and Wilhit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to accept Bradley's deal... Koenig pets Hector's twin Doberman guard dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and although the terms of that deal worked well for him. I found them less than favorable... Koenig draws a silenced pistol and shoots both dogs befor shooting a shocked Hector twice in the chest. Wilhite staggers to his feet as Koenig steps over and delivers th coup de grace head-shot to Hector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darktown. Chavez Ravine. Hot Spots for Human Vice. These are slums I run & profit from. If these slums suddenly become Stadiums, that profit goes elsewhere...that crime goes elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bradley...you two got greed in common. Koenig grins. Junior keeps shifting. Dying to shoot him d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew about Wilhite and Lucille. That's how you were operating him. KOENIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was aware of his sexual predilections. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a scowl for Junior) ...and someone else's... KOENIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (that great white grin ) We share an eye for human frailty and we're both born blackmailers Dave. (beat) I knew young Stemmons here had a fondness for Lads, stretching back to his days at the academy. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now you're his only ally. (back at Junior) This sad queer who fell out with cops and flunked out with the Feds. (back to Koenig) So you get this file to battle Bradley with. What's Junior get in return? And like he was waiting for those words: Junior lunges. I twist to deflect but he's too fast -- feel something sink drag in my side. I go down, gouge/groping for my gun. Ins trauma zaps nerves numb up the arm, fingers failing. Then pain like boiling oil moves through my blood. JUNIOR STEMMONS

dialogues.speaker: JUST YOU
dialogues.text: Look down, SEE: A mother-of-pearl knife hilt in my side, business end stuck deep. Junior laughing as I fall to my knees. He pulls the file from the waist and tosses my .45 JUNIOR STEMMONS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (two inches from my face)

dialogues.speaker: THERE'S YOUR KNIFE KLEIN
dialogues.text: Koenig takes the file, opening it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KOENIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning his back) I don't want to watch...I'm sorry it came to this, Dave. Junior, his own .45 pulled, put to my head. JUNIOR STEMMONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope the Bledsoe whore was worth it...'cuz she's still fucked. For a crooked cop, you think small. Koenig reads the file's first page, lifts it...a blank pa behind...and behind that one... ME (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever moves I had left...I just made. Koenig spins back, more blank pages spilling from the fil KOENIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't it! -Junior looks: that's all I need. Pull the pig-sticker of ankle and corkscrew it into his calf, twisting. Junior bl slaughtered-lamb as I reach up a wrench his gun free. Gra his tie, pull him down as I jut his gun up under his chin fire two shots through the top of his head. Haul him down dead by his tie, turn -- Koenig's gun-hand flashes to his shoulder. Shoot him twice. He goes down gargling `fuck'. Stand-up on me sea-legs, bad wobble/weav I slowly pull the knife from my side, pocket it. Feel blo flow saturate my pant leg. This weird wooze overcomes me approach Koenig. He pulls himself into a sitting position, shaking his hea This bemused, beaten, half-grin as he flicks blood from h hand like his fingers had just brushed something sticky. KOENIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poorly played Dave...poorly played... Say nothing. Keep Junior's .45 out. My intention crystal clear: endgame. Koenig looks up, this odd squint, like a about to beg for change. KOENIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I talk you into something? Cut you in on something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him no hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't work for me Fritz. He nods, remorse, resignation...it at all looks the same

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a minute then? I do. Watch his hands as he removes his shoes, waiting fo ankle grab, his back-up piece...none comes. He sets his s aside, gazing up at the starless sky before issuing this short, gruff laugh...some inside joke that will die untol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a nod)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... ...and he holds his last breath and seems completely cont as I shoot him. Cross to Junior now, rifle his clothes, retrieve a hotel key, Room 16, read it: MOTEL COMMODORE - 1195 Centinela Ave. Inglewood, CA 90302

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George Ainge, sweating on a stained bedsheet, smoking ree goofing on a TV test pattern, randomly pulling at his dic Walk by his window, he sees me, recognition kinks -- thin this is a good sign...I shoot him right through the glass 96   EXT. TUDOR MANSION - EARLY A.M. Bradley, roused from sleep, silk robe, coming down the stairs, his back door wide open. Reaches the landing, tur on the light. Feature me, this bobble-eyed ghoul, bloodying his settee. look like something exhumed. His monogrammed serving napk soak up blood from my knifed side. He startles school-gir Throw the file at his feet: marred, mangled, stained. He inches forward, cinching his robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fritz Koenig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going pale) Where? ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead. Along with Wilhite, Junior...and Hector Magdalena. BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here? ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To collect. I have the things you need to destroy Noonan's play. These same things can be used to destroy you. Bradley, prim, proper, even this early. He sits down acro from me like some fucking Duke. BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things like? ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stemmons files...and Wilhite's body. He committed suicide after you subpoenaed him. BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This body is in your possession? Just nod. ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's what you need to burn Narco to the ground...but if those files and his body were to be given to Noonan and the Feds, with me providing the cherry-on-top testimony of a rogue cop. Well. The word `Cataclysmic' comes to mind. BRADLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will this cost? ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A percentage of your Dodger Stadium stake in perpetuity. You buy my silence for a fourth of Hurwitz Holdings. Bradley scoffs, pithy smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doubtful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you expect? A stick-up? Empty your safe? I'm about to disappear for good, and you're gonna fund my new life. You can't counter-punch out of this. Arrest me and I snitch the world. (point to the file)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll hold that over your head for the rest of your life. Renege on our deal and it won't matter if it's tomorrow or ten years from now...I'll fry you with that file. (at my cracked Hamilton)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm officially outta time now Chief. Call it. Bradley: an actual, full-blown facial tic. His Adam's app bobs as he realizes that he's finally been beaten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilhite's body...Bury it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cruising up the Topanga Canyon. Almost home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaking to see her, touch her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Door locked. Knocking. Pete opens up. Standing drunk. A pissed-off nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liquor wafts off of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go to bed drunk, or just been up all night. No answer as I follow him into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Glenda, is she asle-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -round the corner: Glenda shaking but refusing to cry. I pale: what is this? Somebody to the left, look: Milteer. back at Pete: tears in his bleary eyes as he crushes me w a right cross. ME (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen Pete do this a dozen times and every time the same thought: God help me if he ever hits me like that... Instant-drop, moan. Glenda screaming. ME (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't kill me. Pete looks to Milteer, wipes blurred eyes. MILTEER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The harder you hit him the quicker I say `stop' -- and cease that absurd crying. Pete bludgeons me. I try to get closer to Glenda. Feel my nose shatter. Another swing: right cheek detonates. A lef hook to take advantage of my momentum: left eye explodes. Glenda's crying/screaming gets me madder than anything. GLENDA BLEDSOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at Milteer)

dialogues.speaker: THAT IMPOTENT SHIT-
dialogues.text: MILTEER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -touch me and he dies. Pete knocks me down again. My face in pieces. MILTEER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kick him-kick him-kick him. Pete hesitates, puts his boot into my guts: 1, 2, 3- MILTEER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (prim, official) -you may stop. (beat, for the room) Howard determined that this was the price for your time together. Milteer produces a Polaroid, takes a snapshot of my shatt husk, hands the camera to Pete on his way out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still have a job. Milteer gone. I spit volumes of blood. I'll talk with a s for the next year. Pete reaches for me, blotto, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm sorry Dave... Pushing out words past shattered teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put you here...that Powerhawk-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -there's a body in the trunk-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -burn it. Big drunk nod from Pete. Glenda panicking, trying to stan blood that keeps rushing. Pete, reeling drunk, leans down stuffs something in my jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steaming water. Almost painful. I sit in the tub, let the shower rain down. Drain floods diluted red. Wash my wound my soul. So many bruises I look bubonic. My face still swelling, already purple-black. My left eye more than swo shut. On the other side of the curtain: Glenda naked. Beauty that catches in my chest. Try to sta turn my destroyed face. She gently pushes me back down. S into me, holds my face in both hands so that the water hi my lips. No nerves, no unease. Home. She closes the curta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Post-coital. Both wide awake. Still scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me take you to a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd never make it inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm through the worst of it. She frames my face with her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you. Lies will only leak, expose. The silence makes me just as guilty. She lets me off the hook, her head on my arm, lea in. I kiss her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was I worth this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever the cost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that. A nod. An understanding. Another kiss, the last one I'll remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Head shaved. Stopped bleeding. You clearly see what my fa will look like 25 years hence. Gauze over my left eye. Reading the Paper: my dress-blue photo, the one that look nothing like me now. Headline: `LAPD Officer Wanted in Connection with Recent Rash of Murders...U.S. Attorney Welles Noonan issued a nationwide warning to law enforcement...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My deadline with Noonan: two days old. He and Bradley playing chess by press release.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ME (V.O.) (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bradley relocates the deaths of Captain Fritz Koenig and Sergeant Richard Stemmons to Chavez Ravine...both given posthumous Medals of Valor. Junior dies a hero after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bradley: Professorial in glasses and pinstripes, mid-pres conference. Watch him work...a statesman's guile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop-killings clear the way for Bradley's "Redeem The Ravine' mandate. Dodger Stadium construction moves forward. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Dan Wilhite and Hector Magdalena. Missing. APB's issued. Bradley's press fodder cast them as `outlaw cop and drug dealer' who most likely fled to Mexico. Narco under a full-blown, Bradley-led investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...police unit run amok, who's long tradition of graft, does not extend to other divisions of the LAPD... 103   INT. BEDROOM - BLACK A.M. Just sit and watch Glenda. Listen to her sleep: rhythmic breathing. The little natural smiling curl to her lips. Blonde hair splayed over white sheets. Touch her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't loved you long enough to leave it all behind...Too many enemies. Too many ways for you to get hurt. Too close to me...a decision that will haunt me the rest of my days... The Gillette knife, fold it in a kerchief, gift-wrap it t Glenda. Place a letter under it on the night stand:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "My Heaven: the hours I had with you. My Hell: the years ahead, without. Someday I'll see you before you even know I'm looking."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stand quiet, `grief' the best word but still not enough Choke back tears as I lift Pete's camera and take the bla and white picture you've seen before. Put my jacket on, pull the paper out of my pocket that Pe planted...a TWA Airline voucher. I smile small...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...be nice to be in with a billionaire who's got a fleet of planes, fly you outta the country on short notice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Times vending machine: paper blazing with front page ph of wanted cop Dave Klein. I walk right past my old face. Cops and Feds camped out, looking for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete's penance beating built me a brand new face...nobody gives me a second glance...not even the cops I recognize. Up to the TWA counter: glance up at the departures board- BLACK. Legend: Recife, Brazil, 1978

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm old. Stare at my leather-tan, once-broken face in a gilded mirror. The breaks occurred a lifetime ago, healed uneven. I start to pack my suitcases. Old files you think may have seen before. An old gun you know you've seen bef Movements slow and steady in my advancing age...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My will to remember. My confession complete. Still not enough. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Post-scripts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ME (V.O.) (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me: gringo exile rich off funds from Stadium Parking lots. Meg and Pete: still married. Three boys. Boyce Bradley: Lt. Governor, then a Gubernatorial primary loser to some chump who acted in Chimp movies. Welles Noonan, convicted of jury tampering in `64. Prison suicide in `66. Howard Hughes: a shut-in shitting in coffee-cans at the Vegas Hilton. (beat) George Ainge: body found, murder unsolved. Madge Magdalena, liver failure in `68. Lucille Magdalena: Mother of five. Look back down at HER picture. ME (V.O.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glenda: twenty-five years avoiding her name. Only a photograph, yellowed with years-passed, reminding me of everything I never was. (beat) Then a week-old Times at the place I buy coffee. Her picture sees me before I realize she's looking. Her Face eternal-beautiful... Put her photo in my chest pocket. Push the week-old Times into a waste-basket: a Pan-Am ticket to LA underneath. ME (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and it asked me to revoke our time apart, redeem it...tell her anything...tell her everything... I stand, shatter the mirror that reminds me of how long. as I step out, an old man twenty-five years too late, and MGM-handsome, 1958 face smiles back at me through the sha
